author: kewltie
title: A Demolition Boy & his Cryptid BF
fandoms: 僕のヒーローアカデミア | Boku no Hero Academia | My Hero Academia
additional_tags: Alternate Universe - No Quirks (My Hero Academia)
summary:
Bakugou of the Demolition Squad is famous for running one of the most popular Youtube channels on the web that regularly blow shit up and jumped off a perfectly good building for shit and giggles. He's also famous for his Cryptid BF™, never appearing on camera except for a few bodyshots and all information on him is kept locked up tighter than Fort Knox, therefore drawing all sort of attention and curiosity toward his mysterious boyfriend.

Deku from Deku Explains is a hopeless chatterbox who is known for uploading 20-30 minutes video that talked about his favorite shows and comics and have one of the most devoted following on Youtube. He also can't seem to shut up about his boyfriend Kacchan, who regularly make his presence on the channel as a disembodied voice.

They should theoretically have nothing in common except a shared platform to host their content and an army of fans with an endless curiosity and devotion to their Youtubers. Vidcon is where we lay our scene and the internet is about to get a rude wake up call.
notes:
Based on this nonsensical rambling of mine.

The format and style of the fic is uh particular and may be weird at first but it's made to feel like a fandom experience because for all the up and down of fandom I love it to death and wouldn't know what to do without it. So here's to you fandom!

Updated: 7/10/18 fixed some formatting issues and added twitter trend.

(See the end of the work for more notes and other works inspired by this one.)

If you made it this far, thank you so much for giving this strange fic a chance! That means a lot to me since it's such an unusual style of fic and format so not everyone will like it of course, but if this you like this and want to see more of this particular style please check out my other social media fic but this time it's more canon compliant and it's my love letter to fanon: "love meme, hate meme".

cryptidbfarchive

Demolition Squad posted a new challenge video ft. Bakugou eating ten ghost peppers because he’s insane. In this video we were lucky enough to catch four different mentions/appearances of cryptid bf! Of course no face reveal or a debut on the video but maybe one day we’ll see it happen!
0:52 - bakugou can be seen scowling at someone off screen, we assume it’s cryptid bf bc every one of his crew is accounted for in the vid
5:43 - cryptid bf can be heard giggling in the bg watching bakugou eat the ghost peppers in front of him
6:11 - if you look at the upper right corner of the screen you can see cryptid bf’s hand was sneakily cleaning the sweat off of bakugou’s face while mina is talking to the camera 
7:42 - mina & denki is front of the screen explaining the effect of the ghost pepper on the body while bakugou is off in the background in the far right corner. he is telling someone off screen to come here and proceed to grab their hand in the next frame when they didn’t come as cryptid bf (?? we’re like 90% sure it’s him) tries to fight him off and bakugou gave chase, running off the the screen. IT’S CUTE AF GUYS!!!!

r/Youtubers • Posted by u/Rainy War Bunny 1 day ago
Discussion So who is Bakugou’s Cryptid BF?
So, I have been at this for a couple of months already but VidCon is literally one day away and I think I maybe got it down now. It’s going to sound really bizarre and outlandish but hear me out, guys. If anyone is any bit of a fan of the Demolition Squad (Mina, Denki, Eijirou, Sero, & of course our resident grump Bakugou), then you must know of the famous Cryptid BF but if you actually don't (no judgment but WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN?) then a quick synopsis: so a couple of years ago, DS did a q&a stream with their fans and ofc someone asked if Bakugou 'got a girl' because that's a thing you do when you have someone as hot and unapproachable as Bakugou you kinda wonder who the fuck can even date them. He'd answered that question with the now infamous line, "No, you dumbfucks I got a man," and everybody went batshit insane because apparently he was there since the inception of the Demolition Squad channel. Except of course for the Squad themselves, all this time nobody else knew he had even existed and ofc fandom does what fandom does, they dig. They combed through old vids to find sign of this mysterious BF and lo and behold he was there all along in snapshots and one off comments. The Mysterious BF soon became Cryptid BF because beyond knowing that he exist in vague passing comments we don't know what he look like, his age, nor even his goddamn name because Bakugou keeps any information about him locked up tighter than Fort Knox. We only had glimpses of his hands and other body parts captured by a few stray camera shots so the inside joke of the fandom is that he's as mysterious as a cryptid, finding bigfoot is easier than finding him. And that's the legend of Bakugou's Cryptid BF. 
And on the other side of youtube, you have another famous youtuber call Deku who is known for his insightful fandom commentary, dissection of media content, and his totally adorkable personality. He's precious, sweet, and I and many other would lay down our life for him. He's also helplessly smitten with his bf of many years, Kacchan. It's a common joke among his fandom how he can't stop bringing up his bf every chance he get ("Kacchan thinks X and Y" , "X is Kacchan's fav char", and "Kacchan did this and that,") even in videos that you couldn't possibly be talking about your SO, he still somehow bring Kacchan into the conversation somehow. Sometimes, Kacchan will popped into Deku's recording studio off screen and you can hear them arguing a point on the topic that Deku is discussing because apparently Kacchan has a lot of opinion and he isn't afraid to tell it so. 
So what does these two have to do with each other? I followed these two channels regularly, they are my most viewed channels on youtube (I like geeky stuff but I also like to see things explode and people do crazy shit, sue me) so I devoted a lot of time watching their videos and following their social media... that's when I started to notice things: 
There are a lot of other signs and hints that I could add into this list but these are the main point I'm trying to highlight because there are just too many coincidences between these two for it to be nothing. So, I have come to the conclusion through many sleepless nights, watching so many old videos, and going over old social media posts that Bakugou's Cryptid BF is none other than Deku and Deku's Kacchan is none other than Bakugou.

demolitiongurl

So this isn’t my first time meeting the squad, I had met them two years ago when they did a fanmeet in my country so I was was able to attend and had a really great time meeting them. Now, two years later I bought a tix to Vidcon and flew over an entire ocean to relive that experience again and meet the people who had been a part of my life for a while now. I was excited and nervous at the same time because I had to fly out all by myself for the first time ever (the last time, my mother flew with me) just to see the squad in person again but it is so worth it.  
The entire event was loud and rowdy as expected of the squad XD and everyone was one their feet the entire time. You can feel the squad energy and excitement to be here and that made us fans equally happy. The entire time I felt like I was at concert instead of a simple meet&greet. We had Eijirou and Denki doing backflips and acrobats, Sero and Mina having a dance battle, and Bakugou showing off some of his martial arts on stage. They even show us clips of their BTS of their videos and how they come up for ideas and stunts for new videos. It was suprrsingly serious and charming in the way only the squad can do it, Sero wrangling the group to stay on topic but they all have a lot of thoughts and details discussion into each video they’re doing. I was so impressed guys and love seeing this other side of them. 
After that, we all get a chance to go up and meet each member personally and let me tell you it’s the best part and they truly live up to the hype! 
Mina is so pretty in real life guys HELP!!! She saw my pink combat boots and said she loves them so much and that she now wants one for herself. She was so kind and talk a lot to me about my hair and I told her I love how daring and brave she is especially when she is the only girl in a group of boys and she just smiled and told me the fact that I’m here means I’m just as brave (I told her about my fear of flying previously). 
The next person I talked to was Denki and gosh he is so electrifying in person, full of energy and smiles and it’s just like looking at the sun?! He’s such a fun person to talk to and you know he’s the life of the party wherever he go. I didn't get to spend a lot of time with him but I enjoyed whatever I got and if my heart wasn't already set on someone else, he would have been my favorite. 
So the third person I met is Eijirou and I was literally shaken because he’s my favorite and stuttered ask if I can have a hug bc I fought my fear of flying to flew all the way here for him and the squad and he just literally wrapped me up in his arms. God, he held me so tightly and tenderly that I nearly cried. He gently held my hands and said I was so badass and that he should take advice from me lol HE’S SO PRECIOUS GUYS. We talked a lot about my favorite stunts that he did and he blushed when I compliment him and it’s just the sweetest thing, I just love him so much guys. When my time was up, I was so reluctant to go but he quickly grabbed a piece of napkin and wrote a short message to me: “Stay safe and keep being amazing Kaya!” and I legitly held it against my chest for a couple of mins. 
After calming down, I went to Sero and Sero gives a different sort of energy then the rest but he makes you feel so important because instead of me asking him questions  he’s the one that asked question about me: what’s my fav eps, what stunts I like best, where I want to see them go next etc while cracking jokes and smiling beautifully at me. It was just a lovely experience and gosh he’s such gentleman ahhh! 
Lastly, it was Bakugou and his line was very long and there seem to be a bit of a problem with the front of the line? Apparently someone in front asked Bakugou about a youtuber name Deku and the people around her were kinda screaming about it and Bakugou just snapped and said he doesn't know anything. So then it was finally my turn to stand in front of his table Bakugou raised his brow up and said, “oh, it’s you again.” Apparently, Bakugou was the only one to remembered my face from two years ago!!!! He actually seems to recognized a lot of the regular fans who come to these fanmeets a lot. Though he couldn’t be bother saying or knowing their actual name but called the girl behind me ‘Jellyfish’ bc she wore a hat with long strings hanging down in their first meeting lol and I am ‘Chipmunk Teeth’ bc well my teeth but I didn’t mind it because he said I changed quite a bit from last time and even brought up my fear of flying that I had mentioned from my first meeting! He was sarcastic and frank and didn’t smile like the rest but he remembers everything, talked to me seriously about what stunt of theirs I like best and what I think they could improve on, and then gave me advice about flying safely and how to calm my fear in a really brisk away but I could tell he was sincere about it even though he told me not to puke on myself when I get back on the plane lol. 
Eventually the event ended and I was so painfully heartbroken because they were so amazing, each and everyone of them are larger than life. I started watching Demolition Squad when they first started as a small channel and even now after they blew up, I have and will always love them. A lot of people may see their channel  at a glance and think they are just a bunch of dumb ppl doing dumb things on the internet but they’re so much more than that. They’re playful, so talented and smart and an utter delight to be around and they love their fans and each other so much and they show it every way possible. They are the kind of group you want to surround yourself with because they make you happy and I couldn’t ask for more than that. 

#demolition squad #fanaccount #vidcon

flowerdeku: 

[Video uploaded to Tumblr - Transcript of Deku’s Q&A of the 20XX Vidcon: 
Fan question #6: what made you want to do on the video “Let me cry dammit”? I have always been very emotional and prone to crying so I got teased a lot when I was little so the video you did a lot to helped me understand myself better and reconciled that I shouldn’t be afraid to cry. Thank you for that!
Deku: No, thank you for watching! Because just like you I’m also prone to crying whether I’m mad, happy, or sad I just cry and let it out (laughs) but I have never seen that as a weakness. Maybe when I was little but now (shrugs) it’s a part of me and I’m proud of it. We cry for a lot of reasons and I can’t even begin to examine why but mainly it’s a way to release all that pent up emotions inside of us. There are actually many ways to do it, some turn it internally and some externally and sometimes that can be bad because how many people break stuff out of anger or stewed in their sadness but crying is just me leaking water from my eyes (the crowd laughs as Deku smiles) and it doesn’t hurt me or you, physically speaking anyway. If you or anyone hat to see other cry and think it’s pathetic ask yourself why does it bother you? What does it cost you to let me cry dammit? And have you let yourself cry freely before? It’s cathartic for me and-- (stops as he catches sight of someone entering the event room from the back) 

The back rows of the hall suddenly burst into commotion as Bakugou moves deeper into the room, walking close to the wall where’s there barely any people standing around various gasps and delighted whispers of, “It’s Bakugou!”, “Hey, isn’t that guys from--” “Ohmygod, it’s him”, “what is Bakugou doing here--?!” can be heard.


Bakugou heads pass the security standing guard by the base of the stage with his VIP badge and up toward a stunned Deku standing there with wide eyes. 

Bakugou: (he holds his hand out to Deku) Hey, I need the keycard to our hotel room. (pause) I locked myself out. 

A loud scream of “Oh my fucking god,” cut through the room in the room but neither Bakugou and Deku seems to pay it any attention. Deku numbly reaches into his pants pocket and silently hands over his keycard to Bakugou. 


Bakugou takes the key and stares at Deku for a moment before leaning in to give him a kiss on the cheek as thanks before hopping off the stage and make a quick exit stares, leaving the entire audience to explode in violence shock. “What was that? So it’s true that you’re dating?!”  someone demands to Deku. 

Deku: (still seemingly dazed, coughs into his hand) Uh, right where were we? So crying is cathartic for me--” 
Video ends. ]
